snippet: A Supreme Court decision increased the punishment of Abdul Quader Mollah, an Islamist leader, who had received a life sentence in February.
abstract: Bangladesh’s Supreme Court condemns senior Islamist leader Abdul Quader Molla to death by hanging, increasing his punishment for a mass murder conviction from the life sentence he received from special tribunal in February; announcement sparks demonstrations.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court decision increased the punishment of Abdul Quader Mollah, an Islamist leader, who had received a life sentence in February.

headline.main: Bangladesh Orders Death for Islamist in Killings
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Orders Death For Islamist In Murders

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
